reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall it was a great resort. Beautiful beach, delicious buffet, very relaxing spa experience - the hot Japanese bath was amazing.
reviews.title: Relaxing & calm place to be

reviews.text: The service was good except for a miscommunication we had, where we heard that there was a happy hour at the tapas bar from 6.30pm-7.30pm, hence we went there everyday and ordered drinks only to find out at the end of the trip that the drinks were not free - ONLY the tapas were free. We were quite upset that NO ONE corrected us when I kept asking the waiters if all the drinks on the menu are included for the happy hour and whether is there a limit to the drinks I can get for the happy hour? No one corrected me that there was NO happy hour... so for that I have to say the staff are not attentive and didn't really care or understand us.
reviews.title: Great place to unwind for a few days

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: And another con is that everything on that island -food and drinks are incredibly over the top overpriced. The highlight for dining experience were the morning buffet and the chinese restaurant.
reviews.title: Nice place but doesn't live up to the hype

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We got the sea villa which was nice except that you dont have much privacy as u can see staff/ppl walking on the corridor, the boats drive pretty near your villa and your villa neighbours can also see you. If you want privacy, you would need to get the Spa Villas. The bed and pillows were really comfortable, which was a plus.
reviews.title: "Another place in paradise"

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The common TV lounge needs to be upgraded though. The TV is rather outdated and the sofas/chairs at the lounge are old and uncomfortable, surprising for a 5-star resort.
reviews.title: Beautiful

reviews.text: This resort is an island paradise. We stayed in a hill villa with an amazing view. It was great to sit on the balcony with a cup of tea in the morning. The room was spacious and spotless and had an outside bath so you could ablute under the rainforest.
reviews.title: An amazingly peaceful getaway island

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The food was great but priced accordingly. We spent maybe £25 on lunch and £50 on dinner. That was not splashing out on multiple courses and bottles of wine. The service was exemplary. We felt very special. The resort has a policy of calling you by your preferred name. This was very sweet and we got called by first, middle and surnames and also Mr and Mrs James - whoever they are!
reviews.title: Right place if your daily life is hell:outstanding spa

reviews.text: The pool and beach were both great. You never felt squashed in between others. The shuttle bus was quick and efficient.
reviews.title: Beautiful and amazing ambience.

reviews.text: The only niggle was that the longer trek to the beach is not as easy as the resort guide suggested. I would recommend sturdy boots and long trousers. There are snakes and leeches.
reviews.title: Excellent room and location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Plus when we left in the middle of the night, the resort provided a packed lunch for us. Very thoughtful. The staff waved us off at 3 am and I'm pretty sure they are still waving now!
reviews.title: Great stay!

reviews.text: Getting to Marina bay can be a pain. You got to figure out how to go there as the journey can be long, depending on where you come from. To me, the journey along was uninteresting although I enjoy the views of oil palm plantations, small towns.
reviews.title: Nice Quiet Resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: From Marina to this little resort takes only 15 min. The new arrangements in Marina is far much better than before. Staff are happy, smiling and helpful. They give you a good feeling to start your breakaway.
reviews.title: Quiet and romantic getaway

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There are three types of villas, hill view, garden villa and sea villa.... All are good. In hill villa you will be greeted by monkeys but no hassle from them unless you harass them.
reviews.title: Nice Getaway

reviews.text: Food in this island is a bit disappointing. I used to recall the food serve from Chapman's bar was okay, but this time, I am very much disappointed.
reviews.title: one island , one normal resort

reviews.text: The island is very small, so it's also good that you won't expect crowd and noise! This is what we don't want!! There are activities such as kayaking, jungle trekking, but it's very limited. Don't think you can stay there for one week!
reviews.title: Amazing of Malaysia...

reviews.text: I have stayed at Pangkor Laut Resort quite a few times and finally felt its time to write a review. PL is one of my favourite destinations for a short relaxing trip from home. It's got great people, food (seriously great food and I totally love Uncle Lim's kitchen where they use to practically customise your food for you) and one of the most fantastic spa I have ever visited (and I am a spa junkie).
reviews.title: Great and relaxing place

reviews.text: Emerald Bay is also quite and clean with a good restaurant just by the side of the beach. I would also commend the nature's walk- the guide is fantastic and for any first timer, it is an interesting experience.
reviews.title: WELCOME HOME!!!
Yet Another "Experience Good!"
reviews.text: This has probably got to be my 20th time visiting PLR and I'm still not bored of it... Every visit seems like returning home to a second house...

Hospitality is simply too good to be ignored, they really make you feel very welcomed and it's simply fantastic to be greeted by so many familiar faces which have been around for a very very long time! Special thanks to Mohamed, Kevin, Philip, Jennie (who so helpfully organised everything for us, including our special spa request) Ver, Raj, the very pleasant Chinese lady from Uncle Lim's whose name I've forgotten - sincere apologies!!, Ann at the reception counter, and to all the other staff who had together, made this trip (over the Raya holidays) a really special one for my huge family of eleven!
reviews.title: Welcome Home!!

reviews.text: Being the first time to PLR for most of them, they were certainly impressed by the accessibility, the privacy, the fantastic rooms, the great food, the service as well as the overall ambiance (not forgetting how beautiful Emerald Bay is!) and the wonderful Spa VIllage! Having some elderly members and a baby along in the group, we chose the Garden VIllas and as usual, were greeted by Hornbills and Peacocks at our balcony in the mornings - what a wonderful wake-up call by the natural island wildlife!
reviews.title: The Third Visit to Pangkor Laut Resort
